[h1] Bom mas n√£o h√° bolo. [/h1]

A Valve mais uma vez, como sempre, fez um excelente jogo que felizmente tive a oportunidade de experienciar.
O jogo come√ßa r√°pido, comandos b√°sicos e jogabilidade simples, a dificuldade est√° nos puzzles os quais buscam treinar seus reflexos e capacidade de pensar fora da caixa.
O jogo √© relativamente curto, podendo ser finalizado em 3-4 horas, por√©m ele tem um replay absurdo, a vontade de terminar as fases o mais r√°pido poss√≠vel, de usar menos portais ou dar menos passos somados a vontade de conseguir as conquistas, te faz jogar as mesmas fases 2 vezes ou mais.

O que mais me prendeu ao jogo √© sua lore (hist√≥ria) apesar de n√£o ser t√£o profunda no primeiro t√≠tulo, a Valve a expandiu no segundo t√≠tulo da franquia Portal 2. Mas como o assunto √© o primeiro jogo, somos apresentados a uma sala futurista, guiados por uma voz rob√≥tica que fala em ritmo musical, mais tarde sabemos que seu nome √© GLaDOS a antagonista do jogo. Fiquei surpreendido quando descobri que se passava no mesmo universo de Half-Life, a Aperture Science sendo uma rival da Black Mesa ou algo do tipo.

O pre√ßo do jogo √© o que mais me fascina, 20 reais √© o que costumamos pagar em jogos indies ou jogos sem qualquer tipo de desafio, e um jogo de 2007 consegue valer cada centavo, quando em promo√ß√£o apenas 4 reais o que sinceramente √© ridiculamente barato. Ent√£o, caso n√£o queiram pagar 20 reais (mesmo que ainda valha), esperem uma promo√ß√£o ou comprem em bundle, seja o [url=https://store.steampowered.com/bundle/234/Portal_Bundle/] Portal Bundle [/url] ou o [url=https://store.steampowered.com/sub/469/] The Orange Box [/url], onde o jogo √© acompanhado por mais outros jogos tamb√©m da Valve, o que barateia no custo final. Ent√£o, se voc√™ usa a Steam, fa√ßa o favor de ter esse jogo comprado na sua biblioteca!

Portal is an absolute classic.

The story alone makes this game legendary but it has much more to offer, voice acting is amazing, level design is so precisely crafted to make you think and problem solve without causing fatigue, the art and ambiance is well executed and surprisingly holds up relatively well in 2021.

The gameplay is so unbelievably fun that I replay timed challenges or just the whole game regularly. The extra content outside the story like least steps challenges or minimum portal challenges are genuinely fun and never felt like a chore to complete. Achievement hunting is alright, most of them are reasonable but others like ‚ÄúTransmission Received‚Äù are very grindy and overall not fun to do without a guide.

Pricing is very reasonable, it was worth it when it came out in the old ‚ÄúThe Orange Box‚Äù bundle and its retail price of 9,99 USD nowadays is still worth it. It is true that the main story is short but in my opinion it doesn't make the game less valuable. If it goes on sale and you still haven‚Äôt played it, it is a must buy.

I believe that if you pick up this game in 2021 you will not be disappointed and probably will understand the hype around it even after 14 years since launch.
This is my top game of all time, end of story.
Atmospheric, fun and challenging puzzles, and a great sense of humour.

This is the coolest game ever. I remember playing this on my best friend's computer when I was younger.

[h1] "This was a triumph. [/h1]
[h1] I'm taking a note here: HUGE SUCESS" [/h1]

Even after playing this game fully spoiled and playing it's sequel, my experience wasn't ruined. I finished this game fairly quickly, and so, I'd like to give my opinion about this game.

I think the best thing on this game is the atmosphere, surely made possible thanks to the source engine. That feeling of loneliness as you travel from test chamber to test chamber. And this game gives this horror game vibe, which compared to portal 2, is more about action

The concept of portals was innovative at the time and it would lead to it's tremendous sucess and it's very fun to play around with portals, the test chambers were amazing, getting properly harder the closer you get to the end of the game.

The soundtrack really is something different comparing to Portal 2. Portal 2 has this music with industrial sounds and stuff, whereas Portal has this creepy and uncomfortable music (except the radio music and "Subject Name Here").

Overall, great short game, could be slightly cheaper imo.
[h1] 9/10 [/h1]
A great portal that takes me back to the good 'ol days of 2011. (I experienced this game after Portal 2)
